summary.to: Create or update a NetApp account

desc.f: Create or update a NetApp account
desc.to: Create or update the specified NetApp account within the resource group

desc.f: Plain text password of Active Directory domain administrator
desc.to: Plain text password of Active Directory domain administrator, value is masked in the response
Tags are a list of key-value pairs that describe the resource

v.desc: Name of the active directory machine. This optional parameter is used only while creating kerberos volume
If enabled, AES encryption will be enabled for SMB communication.
If enabled, NFS client local users can also (in addition to LDAP users) access the NFS volumes.
Users to be added to the Built-in Backup Operator active directory group. A list of unique usernames without domain specifier

ov.desc: Comma separated list of DNS server IP addresses for the Active Directory domain

v.desc: Comma separated list of DNS server IP addresses (IPv4 only) for the Active Directory domain
kdc server IP addresses for the active directory machine. This optional parameter is used only while creating kerberos volume.
Specifies whether or not the LDAP traffic needs to be secured via TLS.
Specifies whether or not the LDAP traffic needs to be signed.

sch.ov: Plain text password of Active Directory domain administrator
sch.v: Plain text password of Active Directory domain administrator, value is masked in the response

ov.desc: NetBIOS name of the SMB server. This name will be registered as a computer account in the AD and used to mount volumes

v.desc: Domain Users in the Active directory to be given SeSecurityPrivilege privilege (Needed for SMB Continuously available shares for SQL). A list of unique usernames without domain specifier

When LDAP over SSL/TLS is enabled, the LDAP client is required to have base64 encoded Active Directory Certificate Service's self-signed root CA certificate, this optional parameter is used only for dual protocol with LDAP user-mapping volumes.
The Active Directory site the service will limit Domain Controller discovery to
NetBIOS name of the SMB server. This name will be registered as a computer account in the AD and used to mount volumes

values.desc: Active Directory created but not in use
Active Directory in use by SMB Volume

v.desc: Any details in regards to the Status of the Active Directory
Encryption settings

keySource.desc: Encryption Key Source. Possible values are: 'Microsoft.NetApp'.

v.desc: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

createdBy.desc: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.desc: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedAt.desc: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

lastModifiedBy.desc: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.desc: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

summary.to: Create or Update the specified capacity pool within the resource group

desc.to: Tags are a list of key-value pairs that describe the resource

v.desc: The qos type of the pool
v.title: qosType

v.desc: Total throughput of pool in Mibps
Utilized throughput of pool in Mibps

sch.v: Tags are a list of key-value pairs that describe the resource

v.desc: The qos type of the pool
v.title: qosType

v.desc: Total throughput of pool in Mibps
Utilized throughput of pool in Mibps

sch.v: Tags are a list of key-value pairs that describe the resource

desc.to: Create or update the specified volume within the capacity pool
Allows NFSv3 protocol. Enable only for NFSv3 type volumes

desc.f: Maximum storage quota allowed for a file system in bytes. This is a soft quota used for alerting only. Minimum size is 100 GiB. Upper limit is 100TiB.
desc.to: Maximum storage quota allowed for a file system in bytes. This is a soft quota used for alerting only. Minimum size is 100 GiB. Upper limit is 100TiB. Specified in bytes.
Tags are a list of key-value pairs that describe the resource

v.desc: UUID v4 or resource identifier used to identify the Backup.
v.title: Backup ID

v.desc: Unique Baremetal Tenant Identifier.
v.title: Baremetal Tenant ID

v.desc: DataProtection type volumes include an object containing details of the replication

endpointType.desc: Indicates whether the local volume is the source or destination for the Volume Replication

remoteVolumeRegion.desc: The remote region for the other end of the Volume Replication.

remoteVolumeResourceId.desc: The resource ID of the remote volume.

v.title: DataProtection

v.desc: Encryption Key Source. Possible values are: 'Microsoft.NetApp'
Has root access to volume
Kerberos5 Read only access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later
Kerberos5 Read and write access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later
Kerberos5i Read only access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later
Kerberos5i Read and write access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later
Kerberos5p Read only access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later
Kerberos5p Read and write access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

sch.v: Allows NFSv3 protocol. Enable only for NFSv3 type volumes

v.desc: Allows NFSv4.1 protocol. Enable only for NFSv4.1 type volumes
Restoring
Describe if a volume is KerberosEnabled. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later
Specifies whether LDAP is enabled or not for a given NFS volume.
List of mount targets

fileSystemId.desc: UUID v4 used to identify the MountTarget
fileSystemId.title: fileSystemId

mountTargetId.desc: UUID v4 used to identify the MountTarget
mountTargetId.title: mountTargetId

smbServerFqdn.desc: The SMB server's Fully Qualified Domain Name, FQDN
smbServerFqdn.title: smbServerFQDN

v.title: mountTargets

v.desc: Basic network, or Standard features available to the volume.
v.title: Network features

v.desc: Network Sibling Set ID for the the group of volumes sharing networking resources.
v.title: Network Sibling Set ID

v.desc: Set of protocol types, default NFSv3, CIFS for SMB protocol
v.title: protocolTypes

v.desc: The security style of volume, default unix, defaults to ntfs for dual protocol or CIFS protocol
Enables continuously available share property for smb volume. Only applicable for SMB volume
Enables encryption for in-flight smb3 data. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume. To be used with swagger version 2020-08-01 or later
If enabled (true) the volume will contain a read-only snapshot directory which provides access to each of the volume's snapshots (default to true).
UUID v4 or resource identifier used to identify the Snapshot.
v.title: Snapshot ID

v.desc: Provides storage to network proximity information for the volume.
v.title: Storage to Network Proximity

values.desc: Standard T1 storage to network connectivity.
Standard T2 storage to network connectivity.

v.title: Maximum throughput in Mibps that can be achieved by this volume
